SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
EINSTEIN PERSONALIZATION
Configure a Recommender

You configure recommenders to present personalized recommendations to visitors. Recommenders use Data Cloud data graphs to identify who is eligible to receive personalized content, and what content is available to recommend. The recommender also uses a selected goal or insight rules to determine the type of recommendation you want to present. Recommenders can return up to 12 recommendations at a time for each personalization point.

REQUIRED USER PERMISSIONS
USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To configure recommenders:	Change and Edit Recommenders
From the App Launcher, search for and select Recommenders.
Click New.
In the Recommender Properties window, select a data space.
The data space that you choose determines what data graphs are available for you to select.
Select a Profile Data Graph to use for determining which profiles are eligible to receive personalized content.
The menu lists only profile data graphs in the selected data space. The profile data graph defines which profile-related attributes can be involved in the personalization decision process.
Select an Item Data Graph to use for personalization response training.
The menu lists only item data graphs in the selected data space. The item data graph returns item or catalog-specific content based on the data graph root object. The recommender uses this content when selecting what to return to the user in a personalized response.
Specify a Recommender Name.
The Recommender API Name is autogenerated.
(Optional) Provide a description for the recommender.
Click Next.
Select a recommendation type.
RECOMMENDATION TYPE	DESCRIPTION
Goal-based recommendations	This option uses a deep learning model to produce personalized, targeted recommendations for individual users.
Rule-based recommendations	This option uses business logic to mathematically determine a list of recommendations based on Data Cloud calculated insights.
Click Next.
If you select Goal-Based Recommendations, choose a goal that you want the recommender to use.
This release provides only the Maximize Revenue goal. This goal returns recommendations intended to increase checkout frequency, increase cart value at checkout, or both.
If you select Rule-Based Recommendations, choose and define a calculated insight that you want to use to provide recommendations.
Select a calculated insight.
The menu lists only the calculated insights available in the data graph that you selected for the recommender.
Select a sort measure.
The calculated insight that you select controls which sort measures are made available.
Select a sort order—ascending or descending—that you want to use when displaying recommendations.
For example, if you select a sort measure of total units sold, you can display recommendations from most to least (descending) or from least to most (ascending) units sold.
Click Next.
(Optional) Configure any filters.
You can configure filters on a recommender at any time. Continue with step 5 in Configure Recommendation Filters.
Save the recommender configuration to return to the Recommender page.

Personalization creates the recommender. You can select the recommender for any personalization point decision.

title: Configuring Recommenders in Salesforce Einstein Personalization
